results.title: A survey on the application of oral propranolol and atenolol for the management of infantile hemangiomas in mainland China
results.text_hl: A survey on the application of oral @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ for the management of @DISEASE_Hemangioma_capillary_infantile @DISEASE_MESH:C535860 @@@infantile hemangiomas@@@ in mainland China: survey on @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@hemangiomas@@@.

results.title: Oral atenolol compared to oral propranolol for infantile hemangioma.
results.text_hl: Conclusion: The use of oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ compared with oral @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ as monotherapies may result in little or no difference in terms of likelihood of complete remission, decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@Hemangioma@@@ Activity Score, likelihood of post-treatment relapse, and risk of adverse events and severe adverse events, in @DISEASE_Hemangioma_capillary_infantile @DISEASE_MESH:C535860 @@@infantile hemangioma@@@ (low certainty of evidence).

citations.NLM: Meza Viteri V, Aranibar L. Oral atenolol compared to oral propranolol for infantile hemangioma. Medwave. 2023 Dec 7;23(11):e2753. PMID: 38061014

results.title: Efficacy and Safety of Propranolol vs Atenolol in Infants With Problematic Infantile Hemangiomas: A Randomized Clinical Trial.
results.text_hl: At 1 and 4 weeks after treatment, and thereafter, the @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@hemangioma@@@ activity score in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group aligned with the @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ group (odds ratio, 1.034; 95% CI, 0.886-1.206).

citations.NLM: Ji Y, Chen S, Yang K, Zhang X, Zhou J, Li L, Xiang B, Qiu T, Dai S, Jiang X, Lu G, Qiu L, Kong F, Zhang Y. Efficacy and Safety of Propranolol vs Atenolol in Infants With Problematic Infantile Hemangiomas: A Randomized Clinical Trial. JAMA Otolaryngol Head Neck Surg. 2021 Jul 1;147(7):599-607. PMID: 33856430

results.title: Should Propranolol Remain the Gold Standard for Treatment of Infantile Hemangioma? A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis of Propranolol Versus Atenolol.
results.text_hl: All randomized control trials (RCTs) or cohort studies directly comparing outcomes of @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@hemangioma@@@ treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ were included.

citations.NLM: Chen T, Gudipudi R, Nguyen SA, Carroll W, Clemmens C. Should Propranolol Remain the Gold Standard for Treatment of Infantile Hemangioma? A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis of Propranolol Versus Atenolol. Ann Otol Rhinol Laryngol. 2022 Apr 25;():34894221089758. PMID: 35466712

results.title: Non-beta blocker enantiomers of propranolol and atenolol inhibit vasculogenesis in infantile hemangioma
results.text_hl: We investigated the effect of R(+) enantiomers of @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on the formation of @DISEASE_Hemangioma_capillary_infantile @DISEASE_MESH:C535860 @@@IH@@@-like blood vessels from @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@hemangioma@@@ stem cells (HemSCs) in a @SPECIES_10090 @@@murine@@@ xenograft model.

results.title: Psoriasiform rash possibly induced by oral propranolol in a 12-month-old girl with infantile hemangioma: a case report and literature review.
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was switched to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, which resulted in improvement of the @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@hemangioma@@@ and complete resolution of the @DISEASE_Skin_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D012871 @@@skin lesions@@@.

results.title: New therapies for vascular anomalies of the gastrointestinal tract.
results.text_hl: Important new pharmacological therapies include treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Hemangioma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006391 @@@hemangioma@@@ with non-selective and selective beta-antagonist agents, @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and treatment of @DISEASE_Blue_rubber_bleb_nevus_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C536240 @@@blue rubber bleb nevus syndrome@@@ and @DISEASE_Angiomatosis @DISEASE_MESH:D000798 @@@cutaneo-visceral angiomatosis with thrombocytopenia@@@ (also known as @DISEASE_Thrombocytopenia @DISEASE_MESH:D013921 @@@multifocal lymphangioendotheliomatosis with thrombocytopenia@@@) with @CHEMICAL_Sirolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020123 @@@sirolimus@@@, an inhibitor of the @GENE_MTOR @GENE_2475 @@@mammalian target of rapamycin@@@.
